qas.question: How often are covid rules adjusted in denmark?
What shall i do if i test positive in denmark?
What will the danish government do if i test positive for covid-19?

answers.text: The Danish authorities will contact you within 24 hours and help you trace your close contact

paragraphs.context: The Danish Government regularly monitors the risks of COVID-19, and adjusts measures in line with the levels of infection to contain the spread of Coronavirus. If you test positive for COVID-19 in Denmark, you should immediately self-isolate. The Danish authorities will contact you within 24 hours and help you trace your close contacts. You can also call the Danish authorities (Coronaopsporing) yourself.

qas.question: What are the requirements for unvaccinated travellers when entering denmark?

answers.text: take a test within 24 hours after entry

paragraphs.context: All unvaccinated travellers, coming from COVID-19 risk countries and high-risk countries, must take a test within 24 hours after entry. This also applies even if they have taken a test before entry.
